etymologies: early 17th century (as cacaroch): from Spanish cucaracha. The spelling change was due to association with cock and roach

definitions: a scavenging insect that resembles a beetle, having long antennae and legs and typically a broad, flattened body. Several tropical kinds have become established worldwide as household pests.

notes.text: Suborder Blattodea, order Dictyoptera: many genera and species, including the Oriental cockroach (Blatta orientalis) and the American cockroach (Periplaneta americana)

shortDefinitions: scavenging insect with long antennae and legs
